channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: Those people need to follow @hoaxeye, @PicPedant, and @fakehistoryhunt. https://t.co/cV1Ym1Z6pt
item.source:markdown: Those people need to follow @hoaxeye, @PicPedant, and @fakehistoryhunt. https://t.co/cV1Ym1Z6pt

item.description: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can’t switch. I don’t remember much of anything from my childhood (it’s the reason I don’t feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don’t know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.
item.source:markdown: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can’t switch. I don’t remember much of anything from my childhood (it’s the reason I don’t feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don’t know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.

item.description: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don’t tell anybody this, I’m right-handed doing everything that isn’t writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay
item.source:markdown: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don’t tell anybody this, I’m right-handed doing everything that isn’t writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay

item.description: @AnakanaSchofiel Being left-handed gets in the way sometimes, because it’s a right-handed world. That said, every time one of us sees another person writing left-handed, we make eye contact, and have an instant rapport. #LeftHandersDay
item.source:markdown: @AnakanaSchofiel Being left-handed gets in the way sometimes, because it’s a right-handed world. That said, every time one of us sees another person writing left-handed, we make eye contact, and have an instant rapport. #LeftHandersDay

item.description: @midweekcycling I did see one in the footage I saw in people’s tweets, so I wouldn’t have been alone. It’s just hard to imagine feeling like I’d be part of the protest when I’m riding a rental.
item.source:markdown: @midweekcycling I did see one in the footage I saw in people’s tweets, so I wouldn’t have been alone. It’s just hard to imagine feeling like I’d be part of the protest when I’m riding a rental.

item.source:markdown: I reached another milestone in my mindfulness practice. https://t.co/t9fc0KwuvB

item.description:
I didn’t go to the High Park bike protest tonight for the same reasons I left the bike party last month: As a non-owner, I didn’t think I’d feel like I’d be part of it and I didn’t have anybody to meet up with.

Normally I go to protests I support, even if I don’t know anybody there, so that at least I’d increase the count by one. This one felt different. I didn’t feel like increasing the bike share user count by one.
item.source:markdown:
I didn’t go to the High Park bike protest tonight for the same reasons I left the bike party last month: As a non-owner, I didn’t think I’d feel like I’d be part of it and I didn’t have anybody to meet up with.
Normally I go to protests I support, even if I don’t know anybody there, so that at least I’d increase the count by one. This one felt different. I didn’t feel like increasing the bike share user count by one.

item.description:
When the DOJ gets permission to release the Mar-a-Lago search warrant and redacted property receipt, it’s going to be a scan of a paper document, isn’t it?

The answer, of course, is yes. At least technology is sufficiently advanced that copying & pasting text from images is on every newer computer now.
item.source:markdown:
When the DOJ gets permission to release the Mar-a-Lago search warrant and redacted property receipt, it’s going to be a scan of a paper document, isn’t it?
The answer, of course, is yes. At least technology is sufficiently advanced that copying & pasting text from images is on every newer computer now.

item.description: @AlexDRMather @DTAHtoronto @TorontoPFR @moddevelopments @DiamondSchmitt I live nearby, and it’s a big hit. When the food hall opens, it might be hard to find a seat (that’s a good problem for a park to have). The dog park is often full (which means people and the dogs who own them love it) and kids seem to enjoy the playground. Just a huge success.
item.source:markdown: @AlexDRMather @DTAHtoronto @TorontoPFR @moddevelopments @DiamondSchmitt I live nearby, and it’s a big hit. When the food hall opens, it might be hard to find a seat (that’s a good problem for a park to have). The dog park is often full (which means people and the dogs who own them love it) and kids seem to enjoy the playground. Just a huge success.

item.description: @_jackiewong @overloaded_writ This is terrific. The Leung family is legendary in the Comox Valley (where I’m from). The grocery store is so iconic that there’s a mural of it on the building where it once stood. https://t.co/7idxGTiEQq

item.description:
I would’ve been a handsome hero today if I had happened to have hand lotion on me, but I didn’t, so I wasn’t. What I’m trying to tell you is that I just bought hand lotion.

My handsome heroism today was limited to offering to take a group’s photo. Any time I see someone breaking off from a group to take a photo (or what looks like is going to be a bad group selfie [Hint: almost all group selfies are bad]), I wordlessly offer to take it for them.
item.source:markdown:
I would’ve been a handsome hero today if I had happened to have hand lotion on me, but I didn’t, so I wasn’t. What I’m trying to tell you is that I just bought hand lotion.
My handsome heroism today was limited to offering to take a group’s photo. Any time I see someone breaking off from a group to take a photo (or what looks like is going to be a bad group selfie [Hint: almost all group selfies are bad]), I wordlessly offer to take it for them.
